results.title: Flora: scenes from a leadership convention
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Arthur Hammond, Roman Kroitor, Michael McKennirey and Peter Raymont
results.brief_description: A fresh, incisive look at Canadian politics, this film penetrates the surface glitter of the 1976 Progressive Conservative Party leadership convention, focusing on the campaign of Cape Bretoner Flora MacDonald, the first woman to contest her party’s leadership. (Follow-up film: Reflections on a Leadership Convention.)

results.title: Flood
results.creator_credit: Natural Disasters Organisation (Australia) and Department of Defence, Canberra
results.brief_description: Describes floods and their causes all around Australia. Uses archival footaage (1970s) of flooding in Melbourne (Elizabeth Street), Brisbane and Narrabin. Addresses rural and urban flooding and offers advice to property buyers to check flooding potential before buying. Includes interviews with flood survivors and professionals and describes how weather bureaus can forecast flooding. The message is: Beware! Be prepared!

results.title: Floating, sinking, swimming
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Waterworks”.
‘Floating, sinking and swimming’, the third in the series, primarily deals with physics principles that explain the nature of water in relation to our use of it. The rules for floating and sinking are discussed, with Archimedes’ Principle that went further to describe the physics of buoyancy. Pressure, force and density are explained with examples (like the construction of wetsuits and submarines) that differentiate how water pressure relates to solids and liquids. Presented by series producer Dick Beilby.

results.title: Floating rice
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Morris, Thanom Soongnarata and Arch Nicholson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
The simple way of life of the people in the central plains of Thailand and their method of cultivating rice is shown through the wet and dry season.

results.title: Floating life = Fu Sheng [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Southern Star Entertainment, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Hibiscus Film, Bridget Ikin and Clara Law
results.brief_description: Departing from her highly stylized previous films, Clara Law chose a more accessible approach for ‘Floating Life’, her first non-Hong Kong film. In the year prior to Hong Kong’s handover to China, the Chan family, Ma, Pa and their two teenage sons, migrate to Australia and join their second daughter, Bing. Their elder daughter, Yen, lives in Germany with her husband. The settlement in Australian suburbia proves to be rather smooth for the young boys but leaves the parents, particularly Ma Chan, in a state of utter confusion. To make matters worse, Bing insists on giving them a crash course on the perils of living in Australia, including spiders, a vicious dog and fire-prone housing. The film oscillates between a comedy on the foreigners-abroad-theme and a drama on loss and disorientation. Although it gathers all the elements of a standard Chinese diaspora movie, ‘Floating Life’ avoids taking a stand in the debate on assimilation vs. tradition. It is rather a cautionary tale advocating the benefits of finding a middle way. Reference: Shelly Kaicer ‘Floating Life’ Toronto International Film festival (1996). In English, Cantonese and German with English subtitles. Cast includes Annette Shun Wah, Annie Yip, Anthony Wong, Edwin Pang, Toby Wong, Toby Chan, Cecilia Fong and Sing Lee.

results.title: Floating in the Falling Universe of Flowers
results.brief_description:
Created in 2016-18, Floating in the Falling Universe of Flowers is an interactive digital installation by Japanese collective teamlab.

‘A seasonal year of flowers bloom and change with time, life spreads out into the universe.

Lie down or sit still in the space and eventually your body floats and you dissolve into the artwork world.

The artwork is rendered in real time by a computer. It is neither prerecorded nor on loop. Interaction between the viewer and the installation causes continuous change in the artwork.

Flowers grow, bud, bloom, and in time, the petals fall, and the flowers wither and die. The cycle of birth and death continues for perpetuity.

The universe at this moment in time can never be seen again.’ teamlab

constellations_other.name: Flower on the wind
constellations_other.description: Explore the use of flowers in the moving image as an aesthetic and metaphor.

results.title_for_label: Floating in the Falling Universe of Flowers

results.title: Floating free. The Magic rolling board. Log driver's waltz
results.brief_description: Floating free (prod., dir. Jerry Butts): Depicts the skill and virtuosity involved in the 1977 World Frisbee Championships. “The Magic rolling board” (prod., dirs. Jim Freeman, Greg McGillvray): A skateboarding extravaganza which captures every expression of the sport. “Log driver’s waltz”: A short cartoon dedicated to the graceful Canadian log driver.
